Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: myroes
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Hotel was suitable for my needs, not top of the line, by any means, but good location. It is great to have a kitchenette. The restaurant is fine and breakfast was ok. The hotel looks run down. The bathrooms have seen better days - the bathtub didn't work - could only have a shower. But the room was very spacious and the Internet worked well.

Reviews.Title: “a smokey non-smoking hotel (!)and very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Connie G
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and it was the worst hotel of our 21 night holiday. The room at first seemed clean but the linen on the bed and the towels smelt so much of smoke that they were horrible to use. We asked to move to a non smoking room and got told the hotel was non smoking - pity they haven't told the chamber maids whom we assume must sneak a packet load of ciggies in the linen cupboard when on shift. We were woken at 7am by the sounds of hammering within the hotel on the first morning. On the second morning when we had to leave by 7.20, we didn’t get a drink at all at breakfast as they weren’t set up (they are due to start the breakfast service at 7am but nothing was available until at least 7.15).

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, spacious rooms, nice value when booked online”
Reviews.Author: Brit007
Reviews.Content: the walk-in rate is more than twice their $55 usd web offer. $10 usd more for breakfast, which we skipped, since at 14:1 on the peso you get top notch breakfast or brunch in more exciting restaurants a few steps out the door. Fast WIFI on the 6th floor, very clean and adequate kitchenette and bath, but not shiny new, very good value over all. We stayed 9 days and will definitely stay here next time in the city. Mind you: Mexico City is a noisy place 24/7, so being 100 yards from the Angel / Sheraton / US Embassy and Zona Rosa, you're not alone, 22 million people do make considerable noise.

Reviews.Title: “Homely way of Staying in an another country”
Reviews.Author: kavitag
Reviews.Content: The most good thing about this hotel is we have kitchenette in all the suites. This has made my stay very comfortable. It give you the opportunity to make your own food when you miss your home country. The rooms are spacy and makes you feel at home. The breakfast was good and the restaurant was amazing. I liked the authentic mexican food and the ambience of the restaurant is beautiful and cozy. Overall I had a good experience of stay in this hotel..!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very good location for a reasonably good hotel with good rates.”
Reviews.Author: Williams59
Reviews.Content: I received good cooperation from the hotel staff - Rooms are quite spacious - those overviewing the main street are a bit noisy during the week - Close to all important business and touristic places - Rates were in my view quite competitive. I will return to that hotel if I will visit Mexico again - They have a very nice restaurant at the ground floor that offers delicious tasty breakfast-

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: richjan24
Reviews.Content: Wife and I spent 5 days there. For 2 people it was good enough.Were on 11th floor, good view.Bathroom a bit crowded, but ....Hotel staff were very pleasant,breakfast was included, very good way to start day.They even brought us a small cake for our 42nd anniversary.Close to Paseo de Reforma, near many sights, able to walk to Anthropological Museum, Art Museums, and to Chapultapec Park. Felt safe the entire time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but false advertising”
Reviews.Author: buns123
Reviews.Content: The main reason we chose San Marino was because it said it had a kitchen in the room. The 'kitchen' was actually a fridge, kettle, microwave, and a hot plate that didn't work. There were bowls and cutlery, but no pans or cooking utensils. Sort of defeats the purpose of having a kitchen. PROS Good location, in the 'better' part of Mexico City. Subway is just under a 10 minute walk away. Lots of pay TV channels. Free internet. Gym was pretty good-free weights, several cardio machines. CONS The kitchen was pretty crappy. Our room key wouldn't work and was replaced 3 or 4 times, and still wouldn't work. We ran up and down between the lobby and our room. Eventually they gave us one that worked, but it took a while-and no leg work from the staff. The internet was often very slow and dropped out-I think the computers were ancient. It was well-priced, I just wish the kitchen had been better.

Reviews.Title: “a great location along with an accomodating and friendly staff makes this hotel one to recommend”
Reviews.Author: JDandLV
Reviews.Content: James says: Even though I can't compare San Marino Suites to anything since it was my first trip to Mexico city, I definately recommend staying here.The staff's willingness to please was evident upon our request to switch rooms. We couldnt decide if we wanted a better view,or a better room,but we chose the latter.From the twelfth floor we could see el Angel de la Independencia along with a portion of Reforma avenue which led to a microbus station around the corner to the right.I could'nt get enough of the view...especially at night!Also,the continental breakfast was very nice.The minuses...(which were minor) Air conditioning tended to be loud and busy at times...Mattress felt like a rock at first... Most importantly we felt like if we had a problem it would be taken care of instantly. Lizeth dice: Las pasadas vacaciones de Semana Santa mi novio y yo estuvimos de visitaen la Cd. de Mexico y nos hospedamos en el Hotel y Suites San Marino a una calle de la Av. Reforma y el Angel de la Independencia,como no era temporada alta en la Cd. de Mexico para nuestra bien suerte,tuvimos la suerte de hospedamos en el ultimo piso del hotel,en un habitacion con vista al Angel,lo cual fue increible porque ademas de la vista,nuestra habitacion estaba tal cual la vimos en el sitio web del hotel,y el staff fue siempre amable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: thomas9969
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great buy for the price. Customer Service is average and only one person spoke English. The location was great about 15 minutes for the airport and close to almost everything. Room was spacious and very clean. However the air conditioner did not work very well and it was very loud. It got cold, just not very cold and it muffled the outside noise. Overall I would stay again and reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location not so comfy!”
Reviews.Author: nica2571
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location pretty much close to everything, the rooms are nice and big but I went in the winter and it was really cold in the room not to mention the music and noise from the outside did not let me sleep the whole 5 days I was there, I am not sure I would recommend this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff but no air-conditioning”
Reviews.Author: Angiebow
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night, but were booked in for 5 nights. The room was hot in the evening, and the vents were the only â€œair-conditioningâ€�. These vents could be left open or closed. At times it felt as though only hot air was being pushed through, making the room very stuffy. We barely slept and asked to be swapped to another hotel. The staff were lovely and handled this very well. They were very accommodating to us. One thing I did find and not sure it was related to the room, but I woke with little bites all over my face. No-one else in the room experienced this, only myself. It may have been a reaction to something else, but we are not certain. The food was good in the restaurant underneath.

Reviews.Title: “San Marino - Amazing value for location”
Reviews.Author: Multi-Plug
Reviews.Content: Stayed at San Marino during business trip to Mexico City. Superb location, great value for money and decent room. Had free wifi in the room, plenty of space and reasonable breakfast. Staff friendly and helpful. Didn't spend much time in the hotel as tended to dine out at places nearby but overall had a very pleasant stay there. Will definitely return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: melannwolff
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the San Marino Suites this month, and we were pleasantly surprised. It is not a very big hotel, but the room was a nice size, and it had everything that we needed: blow dryer, coffee maker, fridge, microwave, safe, etc. There was even a nice restaurant downstairs. The location was excellent. It was about a block from the Angel of Independece, and a quick walk to Chapultapec park. We even walked back from the Zocalo area, although that was pretty far. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: _Mayda_1
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Im impressed about this hotel. Before go there I read some bad comments about this hotel, but in my case Im totally satisfied about the room, the service was excellent, the persons that work there were very helpful. The room was clean and in good conditions. I totally recommend this hotel. TIPS: The hotel is located one block from the Reforma Ave. the principal avenue of Mexico city. There you can take the "Turibus", a city tour bus where you can visit some of the local attractions like the Centro HistÃ³rico (Historic Downtown), Chapultepec Zoo, Museums, etc.

Reviews.Title: “False advertisement”
Reviews.Author: Sue035
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok. Not so clean, but a good location, nice hotel for the price. However, I got really upset there. They were advertising at Expedia that if you stayed for 2 nights in a double room you would receive complimentary breakfast for two and 1 day tour. It did not happen. I arrived there, showed the ad printed proof, argued with the rude staff, spent an hour calling Expedia from a street phone because they did not offer me their phone. Therefore, I would not recommend it. False advertisement to get more clients is forbidden and Expedia should not corroborate with this. After arguing with Expedia and the hotel for one hour, I gave up. Tips: You have to go to Teotihuacan. It is even better than Chit Zen-Itza in Cancun. The Museum of Anthropology is great. There is a park in front of the Museum which is nice to walk around and see the castle and there is a zoo there. The city has lots of things to see. We booked our transport with cancuntransfers.com in Cancun, it was really good and much cheaper than at the airport. The tours we booked with entertainment-plus.net, also nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the Zona Rosa area”
Reviews.Author: Londinense
Reviews.Content: The experience of the reviewer who complained about the toddler swimming pool must have been exceptional. I have stayed there several times in the past year and it is superb value for money. I live in Mexico and know what to expect in the DF! I have found it quiet and comfortable and the fact that it has free wi-fi is a big bonus. If you book on line you wonâ€™t find anything in this area for anything comparable. Itâ€™s not much more expensive than the hugely over-rated Casa Gonzalez round the corner. Plus you get a free buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Chicago4
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, and I stayed here for a week and we absolutely loved it! The room was very clean, service was superb, the breakfast was more than what we expected! Believe me this is no continental breakfast- more like breakfast buffet with all the trimmings! My husband even got his eggs made to order every morning. The hotel staff could not be any more friendlier or attentive, we came in late almost every night (after 2am) and there was someone to greet us at the door and valet our car with all smiles and this gave us a great sense of security. The hotel is also in one of the nicest neighborhoods around which was a sigh of relief for us. Even though we were in this big city, we felt very safe in this small but very cosy hotel. I would definitely stay here again, rather than pay for those big chain hotels with big prices, and staff that can't possibly remember how you like your eggs in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great price,clean great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The San Marino Suites were wonderful. There is a person who will help if you don't speak Spanish. You might e-mail them. WE ARRIVED VERY LATE AT NIGHT TWO TIMES. There was still valet service for our car waiting at the door at 12:30 at night!!!!This service is just 10 American dollars per day. The room is cleaned very nice each day. The breakfast buffet is very nice. Since we have 2 vegetarians the extensive fruit is very nice. Roberto serves you very quickly in the restaurant. The hotel gives you bottled water each day, fresh towels etc. It was quiet. I was on a high floor. Thanks it was a nice stay. It is near all tourist attractions and within a mile of public transportation. The subways are an easy way to travel once you get used to them. To go to the pyramids you can take a subway to central bus station. That costs .25. The bus is about 2.50 american. The Beaux arts is absolutely stunning if you like murals. It is nice to go into the mountains if possible. They are beautiful. We stayed 10 days and the hotel was consistent the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel doesn't come anywhere near the description one may find on various hotel booking websites. Air-conditionned room means that you get a room where the air conditionning WILL automatically stop at 1:00 am. It doesn't come back on until noon the next day. Breakfast buffet is normally served at 7:00 am. My friend and I had to wait in the restaurant with 10 other people in the dark until 7:30 am. Finally we had to go the reception desk to ask them to kindly turn the lights on. Beware the taxi service provided y the hotel, they charge twice as much as any other taxi hailed in the street. One can find much better comfort and service in Mexico City for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: isaHolanda
Reviews.Content: I didnt find a review about this hotel but the pictures and the location were enough for me. So my partner and I decided to stay there. The rooms were quite confortable, the furniture in perfect shape. The bed was hard but very confortable after a trip of 17 hours by plane. Also we had a great feathers blanquet that keep us warm and everything in the room and the toilet was very clean. There is not carpet, but is a wooden floor and for people like me that suffer with allergies is a great location. The only thing that was a minus was that we were in the 12th floor next to the operation room of the lifts and they were a little bit noisy. But I really recommend this great hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: San Marino Suites Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Rio Tiber, 107 - Col. Cuauhtemoc, Mexico City 06500, Mexico
